title: Awesome List Updates on Nov 07, 2024
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Nov 07, 2024 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Zsh Plugins
items.content_text:
### Plugins / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [history-on-success (⭐1)](https://github.com/nyoungstudios/zsh-history-on-success) - Save yourself from repeating the same mistakes by filtering out your unsuccessful commands from your zsh history file. Based on a [blog post](https://scarff.id.au/blog/2019/zsh-history-conditional-on-command-success/) by Dean Scarff.
*   [quiet-accept-zle (⭐14)](https://github.com/AdrieanKhisbe/zsh-quiet-accept-line) - Enables you to run typed zsh command without triggering new prompt, history entry, or having output being outputed.

### Themes / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [pentest-report (⭐14)](https://github.com/sikumy/ohmy-pentest-report) - Designed for pentesters, offering a clean and efficient prompt to streamline daily tasks during audits and penetration testing. The theme includes decorators for real-time display of the date, time, IP address, current directory, and the result of the last executed command.
items.content_html:
Plugins / superconsole - Windows-only

  • history-on-success (⭐1) - Save yourself from repeating the same mistakes by filtering out your unsuccessful commands from your zsh history file. Based on a blog post by Dean Scarff.
  • quiet-accept-zle (⭐14) - Enables you to run typed zsh command without triggering new prompt, history entry, or having output being outputed.

Themes / superconsole - Windows-only

  • pentest-report (⭐14) - Designed for pentesters, offering a clean and efficient prompt to streamline daily tasks during audits and penetration testing. The theme includes decorators for real-time display of the date, time, IP address, current directory, and the result of the last executed command.

items.title: Awesome Swift
items.content_text:
### REPL

*   [SwiftFiddle](https://swiftfiddle.com) - Playground for making, sharing, and embedding Swift code.

### HTML / Barcode

*   [ZMarkupParser (⭐344)](https://github.com/ZhgChgLi/ZMarkupParser) - Helps you convert HTML strings into NSAttributedString with customized styles and tags.

### Testing / Barcode

*   [swift-testing-expectation (⭐67)](https://github.com/dfed/swift-testing-expectation) - Create an asynchronous expectation in Swift Testing.

### Calendar / Barcode

*   [OBCalendar (⭐136)](https://github.com/oBilet/OBCalendar) - OBCalendar is designed for simplicity and customization, it allows you to build beautiful and functional calendar interfaces effortlessly.

items.title: Awesome Integration
items.content_text:
### Resources / Certifications

*   [API Designer](https://apiacademy.learnupon.com/lpaths/4147453/courses/262369/details) - Validate your understanding of API design basics and best practices.
*   [API Product Manager](https://apiacademy.learnupon.com/lpaths/4147453/courses/262371/details) - Demonstrate your proficiency in managing APIs as products.
*   [API Security Architect](https://apiacademy.learnupon.com/lpaths/4147453/courses/262370/details) - Validate your expertise in securing APIs using modern architectures.
items.content_html:

items.title: Awesome Polars
items.content_text:
### Blog posts / Miscellaneous

*   [Using Polars in Rust for high-performance data analysis ](https://dev.to/logrocket/using-polars-in-rust-for-high-performance-data-analysis-4ed3) - An article that looks how to use Polars to build a basic data analysis application, which exposes data sets and querying capabilities via a REST-based Web API by [@Mario Zupan](https://blog.logrocket.com/author/mariozupan).
items.content_html:
Blog posts / Miscellaneous

  • Using Polars in Rust for high-performance data analysis - An article that looks how to use Polars to build a basic data analysis application, which exposes data sets and querying capabilities via a REST-based Web API by @Mario Zupan.

items.title: Awesome Angular
items.content_text:
### Internationalization / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-merge-json-translations (⭐1)](https://github.com/jonnomk/ngx-merge-json-translations) - This builder helps merge the `messages.json` file, after running extract-i18n, into target files using specified locales taking care to delete removed keys and add new ones.

[Part 2](https://medium.com/rustaceans/make-it-mandatory-a-brief-history-of-rust-part-2-981d61451aa5). items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Communications / Language Compositionality

*   [Language is primarily a tool for communication rather than thought](https://www.nature.com/articles/s41586-024-07522-w) - ***Nature***, 2024. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=13724799649075764503)]. This perspective brings recent evidence from neuroscience and allied disciplines to argue that in modern humans, language is a tool for communication, contrary to a prominent view that we use language for thinking. The authors begins by introducing the brain network that supports linguistic ability in humans. They then review evidence for a double dissociation between language and thought, and discuss several properties of language that suggest that it is optimized for communication. This perspective concludes that although the emergence of language has unquestionably transformed human culture, language does not appear to be a prerequisite for complex thought, including symbolic thought. Instead, language is a powerful tool for the transmission of cultural knowledge; it plausibly co-evolved with humans' thinking and reasoning capacities, and only reflects, rather than gives rise to, the signature sophistication of human cognition.
items.content_html:
Communications / Language Compositionality

  • Language is primarily a tool for communication rather than thought - Nature, 2024. [All Versions]. This perspective brings recent evidence from neuroscience and allied disciplines to argue that in modern humans, language is a tool for communication, contrary to a prominent view that we use language for thinking. The authors begins by introducing the brain network that supports linguistic ability in humans. They then review evidence for a double dissociation between language and thought, and discuss several properties of language that suggest that it is optimized for communication. This perspective concludes that although the emergence of language has unquestionably transformed human culture, language does not appear to be a prerequisite for complex thought, including symbolic thought. Instead, language is a powerful tool for the transmission of cultural knowledge; it plausibly co-evolved with humans' thinking and reasoning capacities, and only reflects, rather than gives rise to, the signature sophistication of human cognition.

items.title: Awesome Go
items.content_text:
### Zero Trust / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [OpenZiti (⭐3.4k)](https://github.com/openziti/ziti) - A full, open source zero trust overlay network. Including numerous SDKs for numerous languages such as [golang (⭐108)](https://github.com/openziti/sdk-golang) allowing you to embed zero trust principles directly into your applications. The [OpenZiti Test Kitchen](https://github.com/openziti-test-kitchen) has numerous examples to draw inspiration from including a [zero trust ssh client - zssh (⭐39)](https://github.com/openziti-test-kitchen/zssh)
items.content_html:
Zero Trust / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

  • OpenZiti (⭐3.4k) - A full, open source zero trust overlay network. Including numerous SDKs for numerous languages such as golang (⭐108) allowing you to embed zero trust principles directly into your applications. The OpenZiti Test Kitchen has numerous examples to draw inspiration from including a zero trust ssh client - zssh (⭐39)
